pullrequest.title: Save Mercurial (instead of Subversion) revision data of labscript file in h5 file

content.raw:
Example h5 output where an imported file in labscriptlib has uncommitted changes:

![labscript_hg_info.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/g75Ex9/images/1317045404-labscript_hg_info.png)
content.html: Example h5 output where an imported file in labscriptlib has uncommitted changes:

pullrequest.title: Save Mercurial (instead of Subversion) revision data of labscript file in h5 file

content.raw:
I think this looks good. We should probably test to confirm what happens if hg is missing, but I suspect it should have the same behaviour as the previous SVN code.

Ultimately I'd like to make the version control system configurable (e.g. Hg/SVN/Git), but that's probably unnecessary gold plating at the moment.
content.html:
I think this looks good. We should probably test to confirm what happens if hg is missing, but I suspect it should have the same behaviour as the previous SVN code.

Ultimately I'd like to make the version control system configurable (e.g. Hg/SVN/Git), but that's probably unnecessary gold plating at the moment.

pullrequest.title: Save Mercurial (instead of Subversion) revision data of labscript file in h5 file

content.raw:
Presently the labscript suite requires mercurial for installation, so I think this is fine! It might not be a mercurial repository of course, but then this code will just save "abort: no repository found" for each command.

Configurable version control system makes sense, but yeah, this is good for the moment.
content.html:
